displayName.text: St. John the Baptist Catholic Church

formattedAddress: 213 W 30th St, New York, NY 10001, USA
adrFormatAddress: 213 W 30th St, New York, NY 10001, USA

originalText.text: Very nice Franciscan church near Penn Station. Beautiful details, windows and paintings! If you want to see Saint Padre Pio, this is the place! They also have confessions during the week at good times too!

text.text: Very nice Franciscan church near Penn Station. Beautiful details, windows and paintings! If you want to see Saint Padre Pio, this is the place! They also have confessions during the week at good times too!

originalText.text:
Gorgeous church located in the heart of Manhattan, New York City, USA.,It is the perfect place to get away from all the commotion and spend a few moments with God. I am grateful to have visited this church 2  times.
I came to  this church to attend the Feast Day of Padre Pio and to see his relics.  Always great solitude...I feel God's Love there every time I've visited. Happy Feast Day Padre Pio.

originalText.text:
Updating the below review, which had two stars. Thanks to Tom. He followed up, listened, acknowledged the issues, sincerely apologized and took appropriate steps to make amends. Much appreciated.

This church isn’t what it was. If you must have a funeral there or any ceremony of circumstance make sure the priest knows both the spelling and proper pronunciation of the name(s) involved. They are rote and ritual is perfunctory nothing more and they won’t hesitate to relay that sentiment with the utmost clarity.

They are rote and ritual is perfunctory nothing more and they won’t hesitate to relay that sentiment with the utmost clarity.

originalText.text: Lovely church. I came here for the first time during the celebration of the feast day of St. John the Baptist. I went inside and saw someone talking to a lady behind a window, which is where you can buy Catholic items (candles, rosaries, prayer cards, books, statues etc...) I went in to pray then asked someone for information about candles and was directed to a monk or brother who happened to be standing by. He was very polite, informative and soft-spoken. Actually, all of the people there were older and friendly. I learned that the church would be celebrating the feast of Our Lady of Perpetual Help (Succor) and would have a procession on June 26th. The service was from 6:30pm to 8:15pm and refreshments were served afterward. This was a very nice service to attend and experience.

originalText.text: Beautiful little church and great reprieve from all your worries and problems, whenever I go there a feeling of peace comes to me along with hope. Also a great place of devotion to Saint Padre Pio.
